de.affect.emotion

Class Emotion

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.affect.emotion.Emotion
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PADEmotion

    public class Emotion
extends java.lang.Object
    The Emotion class represents the emotional state of an agent. Each emotion has a type, an appraisal aspect, an activation aspect, an intensity and a baseline. The intensity is is associated with an emotion-inducing situation.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Patrick Gebhard (based on the work of Martin Klesen)

      Emotion(EmotionType type, double intensity, double baseline, java.lang.Object elicitor)
      Constructs a new Emotion object with the specified type and the specified intensity which is associated with an emotion-inducing situation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Emotion

        public Emotion(EmotionType type,
       double intensity,
       double baseline,
       java.lang.Object elicitor)
        Constructs a new Emotion object with the specified type and the specified intensity which is associated with an emotion-inducing situation.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the emotion.
        intensity - the intensity of the emotion.
        baseline - the baseline of the emotion.
        elicitor - the emotion-inducing situation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the intensity or the baseline is not a real number in the interval [0.0,1.0] or if the intensity is less than the baseline.

      • Emotion

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Compares this emotional state to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument is an Emotion object with the same emotion type emotion intensity, and emotion elicitor.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - the object to compare this emotion against.
        Returns:
        true if the two emotions are equal; false otherwise.
